posts._title: Adolf Born & Jaroslav Doubrava & Milos Macourek – O Matylde s náhradní hlavou AKA Matylda and her Spare Head (1985)
posts.title: O Matylde s náhradní hlavou
posts.excerpt: Quote:In one town there lives a little girl named Matylda, who likes to play, but doesn’t like to study – when she has to do, she remembers little. Her mom comes up with the idea to buy her some extra heads: one for Maths, one for poetry and so forth. Matylda gets all her heads …
posts.director: Adolf Born & Jaroslav Doubrava & Milos Macourek

posts._title: Ghyslaine Côté – Elles étaient cinq AKA The Five of Us (2004)
posts.title: Elles étaient cinq
posts.excerpt: In Montreal, the teenagers Manon, Anne, Isa, Claudie and Sophie are friends since their childhood. While spending a couple of days in the cottage of Sophie’s parents nearby a lake, the girls decide to give a party, and Manon and Sophie hitch for a ride to the town in a jeep to buy some beers …

posts._title: André De Toth – Day of the Outlaw (1959)
posts.title: Day of the Outlaw
posts.excerpt: Eastman Museum writes:According to Quentin Tarantino, his eighth and latest film not only pays homage to that peculiar brand of the western set not in dust but in snow, but also an even more peculiar genre of the so-called parlor room mystery. André De Toth’s criminally underrated Day of the Outlaw happened to mine a …

posts.title: September (1987)

posts.title: Unchain (2000)
posts.excerpt: Quote:Documentary on the Japanese boxer Unchain Kaji, who retired from the ring at the age of 30 with an eye injury and a losing record. He then tries to start a new life as a civilian.

posts._title: Gordon Flemyng – Daleks’ Invasion Earth 2150 A.D. (1966)
posts.title: Daleks’ Invasion Earth 2150 AD
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:This sequel to `Dr Who and the Daleks’ finds Doctor Who returning to Earth in AD 2150, only to find it almost destroyed by cosmic rays, and the Daleks moving in to hollow out the planet’s core to turn it into a gigantic spaceship.
